Bought an external CR Rom Reader/Writer ( ASUS so there was no conflicts) Enough hard drive to load QuickBooks & Office.  Still quick and responsive.  Keyboard has a great touch but now I see the benefit of having a backlit keyboard.( Would have been a nice addition)  Battery life is OK.  As stated so I can not complain.  No problems upgrading to Windows 8.1 although updates were needed first and I had a problem loading them.  After the third try I was able to do so & 8.1 loaded up with no problem.  It did take a bit of time to do so. Wireless setup went smoothly.  So far so good.  Price was right and I am happy.  I did buy a clear shell that will protect my new pretty in pink laptop !

Reviews.Title: Bought as Xmas gift
Reviews.Author: meowmeow
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our niece as a Christmas gift...she uses it daily for college and personal work.  Loves the computer, light and portable...no problems at all....it's been 4 months.

Reviews.Title: Great for school
Reviews.Author: Natalia A.
Reviews.Content: I'm a student and it gets so much easier to take notes on a laptop rather than in a notebook these days. So I purchased this product mainly because I wanted a smaller sized laptop (my previous one is 15.6 inch) that I could grab with me and head to class or work. For that matter, works great! And also, I use it to watch my tv shows online and just browse through the web. So if you are looking for a laptop for an average user like me, I think you would love this one. I even got the pink one because it was like USD$90 cheaper than the other ones and I really like it. The looks are amazing.Soy una estudiante y me parece mucho más fácil tomar notas en una laptop que en un cuaderno. Así que compré este producto porque quería un tamaño más pequeño de computador (mi anterior medía 15.6 pulgadas) que simplemente pudiera llevar conmigo a la universidad o al trabajo. Para eso, funciona demasiado bien! Y también la uso para ver mis series online y navegar en la web. Así que si estás buscando una laptop para un usuario promedio como yo, creo que te va a encantar esta. Incluso compré la rosada porque era USD$90 más barata que las otras y de verdad me gusta bastante. Se ve bien bonita y fina.

Reviews.Title: You get the most bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: CO
Reviews.Content: Although Windows 8 takes time to get accustomed to, once you do, you easily grow to love it. Laptop itself is great. Small and lightweight. Perfect for office work and leisure. I love it.

Reviews.Title: Great ultrabook for the price
Reviews.Author: Cem
Reviews.Content: Just got it.  Good looking and good performance.  Cannot go wrong with this price.  It would have been better with Windows 8.1.

Reviews.Title: Great combination of Form & Function
Reviews.Author: That Guy B
Reviews.Content: http://youtu.be/9ifQqJycl-cThat's a short video of my vivobook turning into a wooden lap top. The vivobook is a great buy for those looking for a slim, portable laptop. I initially planned on using an iPad or similar Android tablet with a bluetooth keyboard but this Vivobook was way cheaper than those options (You can find it for 350-450 if you wait for a sale).The vivobook is very slim and lightweight making it easy to carry around. You're getting a touchscreen and full fledged laptop for the same price as a 16gb iPad Air. It's been very convenient to have a fully functional Microsoft Office when I'm trying to get work done. That said, the app store for Windows is pretty lacking. They have big name apps like Pandora but lack choices. I'm glad I didn't spring for a windows tablet because I would have been pretty disappointed.

Reviews.Title: The Laptop is great! Windows 8 takes some getting use to.
Reviews.Author: bluelightsmove
Reviews.Content: My daughter loves this laptop. She hated it at first because Windows 8 was so hard to get use to. Now that she has used if for a while and with some help/training from me, she is doing fine with it now. The hardware is well built and it's fast and light.

Reviews.Title: keyboard did not function properly
Reviews.Author: Lloyd Barber
Reviews.Content: I could not get started with setting the computer up because some of the keys on the keyboard would not work.  I contacted ASUS and was told I could send it to them and they would fix it or replace it with a reconditioned one.  I decided to return it for a refund.  I believe it would be a good item if it had worked properly.

Reviews.Title: Great product for price
Reviews.Author: E. Ervin
Reviews.Content: This is exactly what I was looking for minus the color, which is a little weird, but hey, it was cheaper! This little computer is a great travel companion and has everything I need - mainly, internet and sound, though I'm happy writing documents, power points, etc. The touch screen is still a little weird but not hard to figure out. I highly recommend this!

Reviews.Title: So far, so good!
Reviews.Author: John L. Jones
Reviews.Content: I bought this item as a gift for my daughter. When she unwrapped it, she said it was "perfect". As of yesterday 1 week later she is still getting used to it. "So far,so good", as she put it. The color had a lot to do with my purchase. Ask me again in 6 months and I will have a better idea for a true rating for the machine!

Reviews.Title: Excellent little computer
Reviews.Author: Sixta T. Hall
Reviews.Content: Asus computer is a nice  with all the features I needed. It performs according to expectations. It small size give me the portability and storage I need.  Excellent purchase.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Terri
Reviews.Content: This was Christmas gift for my daughter.  It was her 18th and she needed something to take along with her to college.  She'd love it.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Clemence Delpon de Vaux
Reviews.Content: The touchcreen is very Nice. The apps also. The batterie life is good, around 4 hrs when fully charged, but when the battery is very low it tale a long time to recharch it.

Reviews.Title: asus vicobook (pink)
Reviews.Author: sara semsi
Reviews.Content: the pink is cutee aand I love the touch screen. the screen is a good size and the keyboard is comfy

Reviews.Title: Really handy laptop
Reviews.Author: Rachael Regan
Reviews.Content: Really nice laptop. Compact, touch screen is nice, and the sound is great. The only complaint has to do with windows 8 - the format is cool, but clunky and the apps aren't worth their handiness. Have had several issues getting used to the system.

Reviews.Title: Happy wife happy life
Reviews.Author: Fred Trosvik
Reviews.Content: This was a gift to my wife for Christmas. My son did alot of research and found this laptop to be the best for the price. Not to big and not too small. She loves it.

Reviews.Title: Love IT!
Reviews.Author: HelN
Reviews.Content: Very Light and easy to carry around in my purse. Nice girly color, very beautiful, fast and effective to use anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Great little laptop
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Got this for my daughter.  It's a nice light size and has nice sound.  The touch screen is very nice and I use it more than I though I would.  The only thing I don't like is Windows 8.  We have had lots of trouble learning it.  I've been a windows guy for many years.  I'd say above average on windows knowledge but I really don't care for windows 8 at all. It's been hard finding what we need and how to do stuff.  It will take time but I'm sure we will get use to it.Overall, good laptop for the price.  Nice screen, good sound, and a quality case.  Light weight and very portable.  It appears to run apps at a nice speed.

Reviews.Title: Works great but it crashes every now and then
Reviews.Author: Forrest Wilkins
Reviews.Content: It has a very sleek design and is a fast laptop for the price. The only problem is it crashes on occasion with no shutdown process, it just turns off immediately at random. This barely ever happens but is worrying when it does happen. Aside from that it was a great buy that I don't regret.

Reviews.Title: It's a beautiful computer
Reviews.Author: Yickon Moy
Reviews.Content: It is light and easy to use as it said it would be.  However, it runs a little slower than my MacAir.  But, good value.

Reviews.Title: Like it very much
Reviews.Author: Vickie
Reviews.Content: Light weight, small but works great, still trying to get used to Windows 8.1, but the touch screen is great.  It does not take a lot of space on the kitchen counter, but I can still type my 80 wpm like on my full keyboard.

Reviews.Title: Good for my sister
Reviews.Author: Emilio Coello Ramos
Reviews.Content: So nice i was an experience really good........ I need now an disk driver but not is important ok

Reviews.Title: ASUS VIVO BOOK
Reviews.Author: Gail
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THE SIZE. IT'S LIGHT ENOUGH FOR ME TO TAKE ANY WHERE. THE SOUND AND PICTURE ARE GREAT. I'M REALLY IMPRESSED. LOVE IT.

Reviews.Title: nice looking ultrabook
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: this is a gift to my wife who had a 15.4inch toshiba for a couple years. she loved it,especially the pink color. the performance is a little disappointing in my view. i swarp out the hdd with a ssd. what a nice improvement! also the battery lasted longer with ssd. now,she can get about 4 hrs per charge. i will give it  five stars if it comes with a ssd for $499. note: the build-in battery is a 2 cell battery. 4 hrs from a 2 cell battery is impressive.

Reviews.Title: nice color
Reviews.Author: diana
Reviews.Content: Although the little computer  looks good, it will barely hold a charge long enough to get any work done on it. If you leave it plugged in all the time it's not too bad.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: erictuong
Reviews.Content: i like it alot... i bought it for my gf like a gift and she love it so much :)

Reviews.Title: Nice computer
Reviews.Author: Miguel
Reviews.Content: I loved this computer.  Felt nice and powerful.  The updates took a while though.  I returned it only because I didn't like the small screen size.  That had no affect on the review score for this laptop though.

Reviews.Title: light and portable
Reviews.Author: Marsha Smalls
Reviews.Content: touch screen is super responsive. this pc gets a lot of usage in my house and so far no issues.

Reviews.Title: Perfect balance
Reviews.Author: Pablishe
Reviews.Content: Perfect balance between price and performance. It look very cool, the materials are very light. The touch screen  is awesome.

Reviews.Title: it's as good as i expected.
Reviews.Author: easthut
Reviews.Content: every function works fine (except touch pad seems a bit hesitant). it's been 2 weeks i received the laptop, and no complaints so far.

Reviews.Title: Positive rating
Reviews.Author: Jen-Yi, Yu
Reviews.Content: Light weight , very convenient for carrying and portable . But the basic facilities are needed to be upgraded . Operational excellence .

Reviews.Title: Keeps dropping the wifi
Reviews.Author: Duffy
Reviews.Content: It is a nice little laptop and seems to work well---- when I can keep it connected to the internet....I am just learning Windows 8 and really don't like it much yet but that is just getting use to it.Wish I could find a way to stay connected and then I would really like it.

Reviews.Title: Loving more each day
Reviews.Author: Freda Angeletti
Reviews.Content: It took me a while to get my start menu the way I wanted it, but after I did, it is easy to use; and the more I use it, the more I really like it.

Reviews.Title: Impressive hardware but really slow
Reviews.Author: Emeka Nzewi
Reviews.Content: For the price I would say it is quite impressive.  Hardware is neat and works very well. But it is a really slow machine.  I have never used a computer this slow before. Is it because it is an i3? I was not expecting a superfast computer but it really takes forever for any little application to start up on this machine. I will definitely have to change it soon. I actually got a Q200e so I don't know if an X202e is any better

Reviews.Title: COOL!
Reviews.Author: Lester
Reviews.Content: This laptop doesn't feel cheap at all, has a touchscreen panel,i broght this for my sister (mostly for her homework) and she is very happy,this metal design feels good,  and the performance is acceptable, (4 hours battery, core i3, ram 4g windows 8)........

Reviews.Title: A fantastic little rig.
Reviews.Author: RST10
Reviews.Content: It's hard to come across a value like this very often. It's a macbook air sized machine, slightly thicker, but just as quality of build-- metal case, glass touch screen to boot.I was able to upgrade the wireless and put in an SSD with little issue. This is a highly "mod-able" machine that power users often go to for a cheap fast laptop that is quite similar to the ultrabook field, yet has a touch screen and is about 1/2 the price of other options. There is only one downside to this one for me: it's a bit weighty.If you have any particular questions please feel free to add comments.

Reviews.Title: Keyboard went bad with in 1 week
Reviews.Author: Mushfiq Chowdhury
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop with a big hope but the Keyboard went bad after 1 week of purchase, the seller didn't took the responsibility to replace it for me then I had to send it to ASUS to fix it and they fix it for me with in 1 week time frame. The Processor fan makes lots of noise compare to the bigger version of any laptop. But Great touch screen response & Awesome portability.I wanted to love this laptop for its portable size. In my backpack it doesn't feel that there is a laptop I'm carrying, its a very light waited laptop into this category of product but don't know when its going to die on me.I don't recommend this laptop for any school students or anyone who is looking for long term relationship with this laptop.If this laptop works anywhere around 2 years, I will think my money is worth it.

Reviews.Title: About Laptops
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: This laptop is very beautiful , the performance is also good, basically reached my request , very much;This is very suitable for girls to use

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Ran
Reviews.Content: I expected the laptop to be faster but I guess it's good enough for this price.Touch works well, Windows 8 is bad, but that's not the laptop fault.

Reviews.Title: nice laptop, Wi-Fi was broken
Reviews.Author: catsupdog
Reviews.Content: I loved this little laptop for a few days. Nice size, decent battery life, and I love the touch screen. I had to spend several hours figuring out how to use windows 8, but it was worth it because of the screen. I bought it because I was going to be without a laptop for a weeks and the price was right. But, the Wi-Fi stopped working after a few days and no driver fiddling or clean installing could fix it. I think the actual hardware was bad. I returned it, with no issues.  Anyways, if I needed a new laptop if give it another try, buy I have my old one one back now so that's that.

Reviews.Title: What I call a gift
Reviews.Author: Jeanine
Reviews.Content: I was waiting for this amazing gift so bad. I don't even have a word to describe it. It's just.... Awesome!!!! The price was good. I love it

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Melissa Schaeffer
Reviews.Content: A friend helped me select this product for doing an online class for school. For the price it is a great product. This is my first lap top purchase ever and very satisfied with it. It is easy to use but does have a short battery life.

Reviews.Title: Came with damage screen!
Reviews.Author: Jula Reyes
Reviews.Content: It came and it looked nice and all but when I turned it on the screen was broken! And then I found a newer version and that one cost less than I one I bought! I got in contact with them and returned the laptop and got a full refund.

Reviews.Title: in built mic stopped working with in 6 months :(
Reviews.Author: Ajay V. Singh "AJ"
Reviews.Content: in built mic stopped working with in 6 months :(Don't know what to do...I am not sure if I can reach Asus for this issue.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value for a compact notebook
Reviews.Author: Chuck S
Reviews.Content: I bought this computer for my mother, who wanted a notebook computer to replace an aging desktop system. Her criteria was that it needed to be lightweight, sturdy and capable of simple tasks such as web browsing, social media, email, and basic document creation. She had a limited budget as she is on a fixed income.I was familiar with the Asus X202E because my daughter bought one for use at college this spring. She is a bit tough on her electronics and the Asus X202E has held up very well for her.This computer is perfect for my Mom's needs. She can easily use it anywhere in her house and does not have to worry about having a separate stand to support the computer when she is using it. It has reasonable battery life so she does not need to be tethered to an outlet. It has plenty of processing power for her usage and it even does a nice job of streaming video. The display is crisp and responsive. The keyboard is laid out well and fits her hands.There are two small issues that we ran into. For some reason the computer got locked up when doing the initial Windows Update. It turns out that something was corrupted in the Windows Updater. I had to contact Asus Customer Service for instructions on how to reload Windows. The Service team was very helpful and we got the issue sorted out very quickly. Not sure if this was an Asus problem or a Windows 8 issue. The other small aggravation is that the touchpad buttons need to be depressed for a longer time than I am accustomed to in order for them to work. I have heard that there are some different touchpad drivers that can be downloaded, but I have not had a chance to check into that yet.Mom did not like the Start screen so I installed Classic Shell to boot directly to the desktop and give her a start button so she did not have to completely re-learn the windows UI. I also dumped the included MacAfee security software in favor of a freeware solution so she would not get held hostage by a subscription fee down the road and lose her security protection.All in all, both my Mom and I are very pleased with the purchase and recommend this computer to others with similar needs. I think it is an excellent solution for senior citizens and also college students.

Reviews.Title: keyboard and mouse VERY poor
Reviews.Author: Disciple
Reviews.Content: Hate Windows 8!  Asus VivoBook good, except I have to use a wireless keyboard and mouse.  The entire area below the keyboard is touch sensitive and will destroy what you've typed.  Because this is connect to the mouse, makes use of the touch pad unusable.

Reviews.Title: Good little laptop
Reviews.Author: F. Passman "Raven Fan"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this refurbished from an Amazon partner for $299.99.  I wasn't expecting too much, but was surprised.  The stock configuration was good, but like most laptops there is a 5400 rpm drive and would get bogged down with too much multi-tasking.  I replaced the HDD with a Crucial M500 SSD and it is now blazing fast.  My Co-workers (I work in IT)cannot believe it when they see a 2nd gen i3 boot up in less than 6 seconds.Very good for the price, but I would pay additional $100.00-$200.00 (120-240GB) for a 7.5mm sff (9mm too big) SSD and replace the stock drive for a very reasonable and good user experience.

Reviews.Title: Pleasant Surprise
Reviews.Author: Philip D. Weiss
Reviews.Content: I like the size and weight and power of this laptop especially for the price.  Very convenient for taking from room to room and occasionally for air travel.  I like the Windows 8 touch screen..although I'm still learning how to "get around" with Windows 8.  I would buy another one.

Reviews.Title: Great total-package laptop
Reviews.Author: Devon Watkins
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a laptop that is touchscreen, lightweight, ultra-portable, decent battery life, reasonably powerful, and low cost this is an excellent laptop.  Their are, of course, other laptops that are cheaper, or lighter, or have better battery life, of are faster, but if you're looking for the whole package for an affordable price, you won't find a better deal than this.  I was willing to pay a little bit more than the cheapest touchscreens for a little more power and battery life.PROS:*  Lightweight*  Great Battery Saving feature called "Instant On" that puts your laptop in sleep mode when you're not using it - when it sleep mode it can last more than 40 days on a single battery charge - and when you press a button to wake it up - it comes back from sleep in less than 2 seconds.*  multi- gesture support for touchpad and touchscreen.CONS:* could be faster at launching apps* The color is not exactly as advertised.  While it could probably pass for "silver" it is really more of a "champagne" color (a slight coppery tinge to it).  If you're really picky about shades this might matter to you.* No numlock key or number pad on keyboard

Reviews.Title: Great litle PC!
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: I love it! the perfect size for what I need. I got the pink one by the seller's mistake and I must say it is exactly the color they show on the picture. I would have prefer the black one but the pink is not that shiny and childish. Of course I will get a hard shell case in black for when I am not feeling like having a pink laptop.The PC so far is doing great! I am writing the review from it. Of course I have had it for just 3 days. I love the touchscreen, I do not need a mouse anymore. I think for the price this is the best think you could find!

Reviews.Title: PERFECT
Reviews.Author: Drew Dizzle "Iron Man"
Reviews.Content: Great product! Specs are amazing for the price, I would definitely recommend this to anyone wanting to buy a nice small laptop for a very decent price

Reviews.Title: Like it
Reviews.Author: Nancy K. Strineson_rick
Reviews.Content: Having some problems getting used to it after coming from a Dell.  However, I do believe thatit is alot to do with Windows 8.  I think given some time I will Love it.

Reviews.Title: asus touch screen
Reviews.Author: Stephen  White
Reviews.Content: Makes windows 8 shine with great touch sensitivity and compact size. Thin and light. Sets up perfectly and runs great.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful computer
Reviews.Author: JG
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace a broken Apple MacBook Air.  It is the same size and is very easy to use.  I also really like the Windows 8 and the touch screen.

Reviews.Title: Slow and Don't Touch -
Reviews.Author: Many Words "Jack"
Reviews.Content: It is slow.  Not sure if its windows 8 or the hardware or both.  Ads come up all the time.  If you are hitting a number key and you happen to touch or get near the screen, you are somewhere else and what you think you were typing, you are not.  Ads were the most annoying!!! Virus protector, and I don't remember the rest.  All the time.  Using quicken, you took a rest as the processor worked through your entry.Returned and got a Levono which is faster and does not have the touch screen... and it is much better.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop
Reviews.Author: Wrat9000
Reviews.Content: I've had it for a couple of weeks now. It holds a charge for a long time. it goes into sleep mode, with virtually no power loss over days. It boots up quickly. The charger is small. This computer power monitoring package is very convenient.With an i3, I don't think of it as a processing powerhouse, but it meets my needs. With the ease of a tablet, but I have a functioning keyboard, and I can run real software, I think it's great.I am a graduate student, and I think this package is perfect for a person that is on the run.FYI. Windows 8 is pretty cool, but it took some time for all of the updates to download before it really got rolling.

Reviews.Title: asus
Reviews.Author: R. Capps Oeters
Reviews.Content: My husband bought me an Asus as a replacement for an iMac.  A few months later, we bought one for him and then one for our daughter in high school.  Windows 8 took a little getting used to but now we love it.

Reviews.Title: Kind of worth the $350
Reviews.Author: volodoscope "Artist by heart, geek by nature"
Reviews.Content: I was surprised by how well build this little machine is. ASUS has really nice design aesthetics. However the choice of finish for outside is quite questionable. I had the laptop in a bag with few plastic cables, mouse, pens and books. The metallic outer shell got scratched like crazy. It almost feels like the paint is coming off. The screen quality is ok, the viewing angles are poor, but it's pretty accurate with touch.This is perfect machine for something quick, small, set-up. Much better than other cheap laptops.

Reviews.Title: its value exceeds its price.
Reviews.Author: Jose A. Moreno
Reviews.Content: It has proved an excellent lattop totally adapted to my needs. Its size is ideal for work presentations, very portable. Its touch display technology coupled with windows 8 enables a greater advantage.The finish is very attractive, beautifully maintained details.It is very fast. It's excellent value for your segment and price.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop with touchscreen
Reviews.Author: John  Yao
Reviews.Content: Great with everything.  love it. this is absolutely the best laptop that I used since my last acers.  strongly recommened for NON gamer users.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: dhoelzer
Reviews.Content: I actually meant to click on the Samsung and bought this one inadvertently.  Works great for my purposes.  I hate Windows 8, but it does work well on this device.  The touchpad is sometimes a bit too sensitive and can pick up fingers and hands moving nearby.

Reviews.Title: So in love
Reviews.Author: Manda
Reviews.Content: I received this for an early birthday present. I love the color (pink). The size is perfect also. The keyboard is really nice and the keys are spaced out nicely instead of crammed right next to each other like other laptops. I love the touch screen also. It took some time getting used to along with Windows 8, but once I learned it, I fell in love. There's a good amount of memory and its very fast too.

Reviews.Title: This Meets My Expecations
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time reviewing available smaller laptops online mostly on Amazon and choose the ASUS VivoBook and have not been disappointed.  I removed from the shipping box, charged the battery and started to use without one problem.  It is now over month and I continue to have trouble free usage and as I travel it is used in many different environments without missing a beat. I thought at first small screen size would be an hindrance (price you pay for having book or tablet) but have gotten use to it and the convince of unit more then makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: Nice Unit
Reviews.Author: C. Poe "CLP"
Reviews.Content: I like my Asus touch screen but if you plug in a usb mouse and then shut it off then pull the mouse before you plug in back in then the touch screen won't work and you have to do a quick repair which is built in and works everytime but it gets annoying.. It's just medium fast but the screen is bright and readable. I also like the smallness and weight of this unit. Overall I think it's good piece.......However, Windows 8 is terrible in my opinion but Office 365 is great....

Reviews.Title: I love my new computer
Reviews.Author: DalitZ
Reviews.Content: Great aesthetics, I like the size and the color. I like the design. sometimes its a bit annoying when the screen turns to full screen when I didn't ask for it. The transition between screens can be confusing sometimes. But generally speaking, its a great purchase!

Reviews.Title: Great value!
Reviews.Author: mikeysmom
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small laptop that was easy to carry traveling and my last one was an ACER Aspire One. I wanted some new features and after extensive research I found this one and love it! Took me a few days to get used to Windows 8 but once I learned to use it and organize my start page I actually like it. The touch screen is needed with Windows 8 and as I have an all in one for our home computer I was happy to have this feature. Great price and value. Glad I bought it!

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Dane
Reviews.Content: I got this for my lady because she wanted a smaller size laptop. she loves it! she particularly loves the touchscreen, but she does use both the screen and the keyboard. Windows 8 does take some getting use to, but other than that I would highly recommend this product for someone who wants plenty of processing, memory, and compact size. This is the second ASUS product I have purchased, and I have been pleased with them both.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Christopher Blappert
Reviews.Content: Good quality for an ultrabook, especially for the price - its a little bit underspec'd for what i use laptops for - moderate gaming and heavy programming sometimes involving medium sized databaseshandles very well though... the touchscreen and 2 finger scroll are normally disabled for a few seconds (up to 5 or 10) after taking it off of sleep if it has been on sleep for a long time, but otherise works great

Reviews.Title: Good laptop, versatil, affordable and small
Reviews.Author: Alain Bolaños Hinojosa
Reviews.Content: I recently bougth again this laptop because some months ago I bought it for my elder daugther and she was very happy and comfy. It's a good design, tiny and powerful, touchscreen and windows 8, in general, all she wanted to store her music, videos, etc.The second one is for my second daugther because she was suffering with her heavy old laptop.AB

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: Caleb
Reviews.Content: This Windows 8 PC was perfect for all of my needs. The i3 processor is no problem for me and the touchscreen is a great feature. I'm even able to do some light gaming, other than simple tasks such as web browsing or writing documents. My only problem is with Internet Explorer, which came pre-installed. This, however, can be easily resolved by downloading a different browser. Overall, this is a great machine for people looking to do the basics on a PC. The price makes it definitely worth buying.

Reviews.Title: "Silver" has a pink tone in the lid from most angles.
Reviews.Author: SalemSwift
Reviews.Content: The computer itself is a perfectly suitable, budget thin & light.  Throw an SSD in to overcome the bottleneck created by the 5400rpm 2.5" hdd.My only complaint is that the silver option has an obvious pink tone in the lid.  It is not true silver, so beware if you're wanting an actual silver.  I noticed it when I pulled it out of the box for the first time, then my friend walked in and mentioned the pink tone without me saying anything.  "It's kinda got some pink in it, doesn't it?"  That's all I needed to hear to package it right back up and return this for a less feminine color.

Reviews.Title: great laptop
Reviews.Author: Caleb C. Boyle
Reviews.Content: bought this for my sister for a graduation gift and she loves it. Windows 8 isn't as bad as I thought it would be either. I liked it

Reviews.Title: Holy moly - HAPPY
Reviews.Author: james
Reviews.Content: I give this lil netbook a 5 star rating because it is a beast. has gobs of memory. and you can't beat a touchscreen!

Reviews.Title: excellent performance
Reviews.Author: Jose Benjamin Cepeda
Reviews.Content: very light and has the right size to carry anywhere, this has excellent performance and the best is the price.

Reviews.Title: I love my little laptop!
Reviews.Author: SKE
Reviews.Content: I bought this computer when my last one stopped working. I love it the touch screen is AMAZING I don't think I could go back to a non touch screen laptop after this one! It took a long while to get used to windows 8 and I still don't love it BUT I am putting up with it. This computer does have a lot more updates than any other computer I have ever owned BUT I still love this computer.The battery life is pretty good I do use it alot and it has been keeping up with me so far!

Reviews.Title: Not Totally Functional
Reviews.Author: Reginald Wilson
Reviews.Content: I bought the device for my daughter who is entering college and when she received it the touch mouse did not work so I returned it.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought it as my laptop for beginning my doctoral degree and it has been perfect.  It is light to carry around in my bag of many books and the keyboard fits my hands.  The touch screen is convenient.  I would recommend this computer to any student.

Reviews.Title: My wife is in love...........with her netbook.
Reviews.Author: Isaiah
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife recently as we travel quite a bit for my job, she absolutely adores it. Touch screen w/ Windows 8 is a nice combo and it really holds wide appeal to my 1.5 yr old daughter who firmly believes that every electronic device is touch screen (even when they are not). 4gb of ram does not leave you wanting in any application and the integrated graphics cover a wide variety of games and other more graphic intensive apps. Don't expect to install Crysis 3 and be running full screen at a great frame rate but as you could figure that is not what a netbook is for. I understand an i3 is a bit of an older processor but considering the price and after seeing it run there is no lack of power in this device....it is well suited for what a reasonable netbook user would require and honestly exceeded my expectations from an i3. I would recommend this item to anyone who was in the market for a smaller portable computer.

Reviews.Title: Wife loves this computer
Reviews.Author: J. S. Craig
Reviews.Content: My wife had been growing increasingly frustrated with her old macbook and needed a replacement. We were a little concerned when the windows 8 updates would seem to get stuck for hours, but a little patience saw us through to a computer that works great. Don't get me wrong, I think windows 8 is an attrocity but the vivobook's touchscreen makes it bearable to navigate. My wife uses the touchscreen all the time for playing one of her favorite facebook games.The computer itself feels solid, sturdy and fairly light. The keyboard and touchpad feel great to use too. My wife absolutely loves the pink color on this particular model. We have no regrets about this purchase except for not upgrading our shipping speed so it could get here faster.

Reviews.Title: Amazing value and price
Reviews.Author: Henry Silva
Reviews.Content: On this PC I do light gaming (Newgrounds games and happy wheels) and lots of work.  And they both run beautifully.  The touch is good for programs like MS word or Powerpoint.  other things like Games, it can not work well.  Keyboard is a nice size Battery time could be longer but I can still open things like cmd.exe and other older programs.  The touchscreen is heat sensing (not pressure.) Running this in the morning with full charge is nice.  I know I have lots of time and a cord that keeps me charged.  The other reviews say the keyboard should be back lit. And their right.  The touchpad is all one piece and it still has a right click! And that is exiting because of the macbook's touchpad that has only a left click.  Over all this is a great product it ships pretty quickly and if you have $550.00 dollars you should get this. And I said $550.00 because with the tax the price goes way up.  Last word: Amazing.

Reviews.Title: A inexpensive way to upgrade
Reviews.Author: B. Baldridge
Reviews.Content: I wanted an affordable way to upgrade to win8 as in a ipad and still have the ability to have a full laptop with which I am more familiar. This was in the price range that worked even though the screen size was smaller than a normal laptop the ability to enlargen the the focal display has allowed me to use te smaller screen.

Reviews.Title: Nice Notebook Lacks battery life
Reviews.Author: Charles W. Barlow "Problem Solver"
Reviews.Content: I really like this PC. I do not like windows anything! So I quickly installed Ubuntu. This little notebook rocks with Ubuntu installed. I left Win 8 installed just in case I need it for something. I plan to upgrade to SSD eventually and have a dual band wifi card on the way. So far the only complaint I have is battery life. I need to keep that in mind when going mobile.Having a touch screen notebook is special. I have a tablet so am used to the touch screen. All in all this is a great notebook if you can stand the 4 hours battery life. I did crack it open, the battery looks replaceable but special too. Not sure yet what a replacement would cost.UPDATE-July 4th 2013.1. Intel 6235 wireless BT card installed2. SSD Samsung 840 Pro installed3. Dual boot win 8 and Ubuntu 13.04Pros: Now have dual band wirelessBoot time is incredible, real fast almost unbelievable!Cons: Bluetooth setup for this Intel 6235 wireless card is difficult. After installed Bluetooth will not pair. I did fix however!Ubuntu works flawlessly as soon as you boot with the new Intel card, Win 8 is a real headache as all Windows systems are. The fix is long and drug out but here are the basic clues for success:1. Uninstall the Atheros wireless and Bluetooth selecting remove driver, do this in device manager. Power down but previously download the two drivers you will need for the new Intel 6235 card, BT_2.6.1212_e64, and Wireless_15.8.0_De64. Bootup and Install both drivers I did BT first.2. Clue-Reverse the antenna wires on the actual card, I had best results with wires reversed.3. After installing new drivers, look in "services", disable Zatheros service. If you uninstalled Atheros correctly there should not be any other service running related to Atheros wireless or Bluetooth.4. Open device manager and go through all devices looking for anything Atheros related to wireless and Bluetooth. Disable them all. The hardest Atheros BT driver to find was in "system devices" With this driver left enabled BT works but only after a hard reboot, disable it and BT will work much better. Do not disable the Ethernet network Atheros it is still needed for the hard wire Ethernet feature this notebook has.Final Comments:The Atheros uninstall does not uninstall all the system drivers. The reason Intel BT driver fails is due to the fight between Atheros leftover drivers. Once all Atheros drivers and services are disabled the new Intel card works great.SSD: The Samsung 840 pro SSD came with a nice clone program. I used it to transfer my HD to the SSD. You will need to somehow connect the new SSD drive via USB to do the clone. I have a Thermaltake hot swap hard drive dock. There are a few ways to connect a SSD or laptop hard drive to USB. I guess if this is hard for you then probably doing any upgrades should be left to a knowledgeable PC tech. I hope this helps someone. I searched and never found a solution to the BT issue so here it is for you to use. If you find any clues I have not found please share, thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: Woot "An independent subsidiary of Amazon" {Refurb} for $299.99.
Reviews.Author: Amiee Hiers
Reviews.Content: I bought mine on Woot "An independent subsidiary of Amazon" {Refurb} for $299.99.This is the best machine I've ever had. It's a great combination of a tablet & a laptop. Well built, sturdy, and durable.It's basically an Ultrabook, at half the price. It is light enough to carry around in one hand or,take it places you would never have considered before. It fits in my purse, with it in a sleeve! I love that!You can use it like a laptop or use it like a tablet! Or both at the same time! So convenient!User tips:1. Watch a "trackpad" motion tutorial.2. Print out a half page list of keyboard shortcuts for Windows 8, or you may get a bit frustrated, being an "old windows" user. Just google for both of them, Easy peasy!3. It has a 11.6 display, but it's a tad bigger than the Macbook Air. Sleeves or cases for a Macbook will either be too small or too tight of a fit. I recommend a case or sleeve for the next size up.

Reviews.Title: good material, terrible software
Reviews.Author: bandita
Reviews.Content: I had an asus notebook before, so I choosed the same this time. Love it. But please may I have my old, good working Windows XP on it? W 8 is really fancy, but functionally is a fatal error. :-(

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: hangyu
Reviews.Content: Light and elegant. Not a traditional ASUS brand style but good to accept it as it is. Limited cpu as it is.

Reviews.Title: smooth but lacks good sound quality
Reviews.Author: Ray
Reviews.Content: I gotta say, the hinge is very sturdy. i expected it to be like the yoga, where once you touch the screen, it would move back, the vivo does not do that. it does what it is meant to do, runs 1080p movies perfectly fine. the only complaint i have is that the speakers really really sucks... if you want to enjoy your media on this laptop (which it's not really meant for) you should look else where or get a set of good speakers.

Reviews.Title: I'm in love with Asus X202e
Reviews.Author: Federico
Reviews.Content: Just yesterday i was able to get hands on this ultrabook. It's beautiful, very solid and fast. I made some upgrades, first i upgraded the HDD with an SSD 840 250gb samsung, and changed the wifi adapter with an intel centrino.I made a fresh install of windows 8 pro. Here i have some troubleshoot.  Duing instalation i was never asked to enter serial number, the netbook itself has (in bios?) the serial number. And even when i installed Windows 8 pro, it installed the basic windows 8.I had to changed the serial number (a serial number i own of Win 8 pro) in system configuration  to upgrade the windows. Far here ok. The problem appears when i try to install some Asus stuff, for example Power4Gear Hybrid Utility or the Live Update Asus program. I just can't. A warning appears telling me this is NOT an Asus computer and it doesn't allow me to run this software. I Believe is because i changed the serial number of the Basic Win 8 that comes for default.I'm trying to install this programs just because there are 8 unkown devices and a "PCI Data Acquisition and Signal Processing Controller" (also unknown).  I installed this drivers from asus webpage: Audio Realtek, CardReader, Lan_Atheros, SmartGesture, Vga Intel 4000hd, ATKPackage and Centrino Wifi adapter.Any idea wich ones are missing?Thanks in advanced!

Reviews.Title: Almost perfect!
Reviews.Author: JRide1
Reviews.Content: I wanted something small and portable for when I travel, since I work from home.  I didn't want to lug around my heavy 17" monster laptop, and this one seemed like a great value. I needed a full Windows 8 computer, and this one is decent and fun.  My only issue is that the Wi-Fi randomly disconnects and then reconnects, which is really annoying when I'm in the middle of something.  I read the other reviews and it seems like this is a faulty laptop that I might have to get fixed or install a new Wi-Fi, which will probably be my solution.  Overall, I really love it and Widows 8 is a great upgrade from my Vista on my other pc.

Reviews.Title: I like the design
Reviews.Author: Sacha Telfort
Reviews.Content: It looks so classy although it appears to be fragile.  I love it.  The experience with windows 8 so far is great also.

Reviews.Title: Awesome product
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: A great little laptop with a touchscreen. It may not be the newest product out there but it works very well despite the negative reviews and for the price it's awesome.

Reviews.Title: A little slow, some processing delays and wifi connection drops sometimes.
Reviews.Author: JOSUE SANTANNA
Reviews.Content: The value was excellent. But I found that it has many legs to navigate pages andsome bottlenecks to process some tasks. The touch screen responds well, butalmost never use it, I see no need. The wifi at times toworking for no apparent reason. But overall it's a good product, good cost-benefit ratio.

Reviews.Title: My Wife love it
Reviews.Author: Leonardo Cardozo Miranda
Reviews.Content: I bought this device for my wife, and she told me that it is a fast and function computer for work. She really loves it. I think it was a good valentines and anniversary gift.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value
Reviews.Author: Janet B. Lewis
Reviews.Content: Very sleek design. Operates like a much more expensive lap top. Highly recommend for someone looking for a lightweight PC.

Reviews.Title: Great, light protable laptop
Reviews.Author: aldo
Reviews.Content: Ive been using this laptop for about 3-4 weeks now and I can say that all the reviews for it here on amazon are pretty accurate. I only use it for going on the internet, streaming netflix and writing papers. It does everything that I want it to do. I feel I got a lot more value out of this purchase than what I paid for. I would recommend product to my family and friends for sure.

Reviews.Title: Great after a few tweaks.
Reviews.Author: Keith
Reviews.Content: After receiving this laptop, I didn't even bother with the HDD---this is an ultraportable notebook (almost an ultrabook), and it deserves an SSD. Like some other reviews have mentioned, make sure to get a 7.5mm SSD, otherwise it won't fit properly. The SSD upgrade will not only make the system considerably faster; it will also improve your battery life and cut down on noise (mechanical HDDs have moving parts---SSDs don't)I also recommend switching out the thermal paste (careful---this will void your warranty). This can help a lot with temps. Note that there's an orange square sticker with a hole in the middle over the CPU---I assumed this served no purpose other than to keep the thermal paste from overspilling. This shouldn't be a problem if you're using a non-conductive thermal paste, so I went ahead and removed it. If you're using Arctic Silver 5 or another conductive TIM, you might want to exercise more caution, since this CPU doesn't have a heat spreader.There are a lot of different methods for applying thermal paste. You'll have to do some research and decide which one to use. Just make sure you don't use too much---that can actually make the CPU run hotter.Speaking of heat, the CPU fan in this laptop is absolutely dreadful. It's not loud by any means, but it allows the laptop to idle at up to 80 degrees Celsius before it starts spinning any faster. If you ask me, I'd prefer a cool laptop to a quiet one. If you ask me, they should've used a totally different design for the fan (can't even call it a heatsink). It's literally just a flat piece of metal with a fan on it. With a proper heatsink, this CPU would run a lot cooler and wouldn't throttle nearly as much. It's possible for ASUS to fix this with a BIOS update, but they haven't done it yet.Be sure you have a good set of screwdrivers, unlike myself. All the screws are overtightened at the factory and they can be nearly impossible to get out with a screwdriver that is worn or incorrectly sized.I got this laptop on eBay for just over $300, and I got a 256gb Samsung 830 for $150---so for just $450, I now have a laptop that's about 80% as capable as a $1000 ultrabook. That's why this thing gets four stars. If you like to tinker and you're prepared to add an SSD, this PC is definitely worth getting used. At the retail price, however, I'd have to recommend something a bit quicker, unless the touch screen is extremely important to you.

Reviews.Title: Windows 8 skeptic at first
Reviews.Author: watchcourtneyrun
Reviews.Content: I didnt want this laptop at first because it ran on Windows 8, but I actually enjoyed learning how to work Windows 8. If you are a low-tech person I wouldn't recommend this laptop, but if you are more tech savvy I would consider this laptop. I love the touch screen and had no idea how I ever survived without a touch screen laptop!

Reviews.Title: Requires Patience
Reviews.Author: Anonymous
Reviews.Content: The main downer of this computer is that it is a little on the slow sideand too many bing apps preloaded.

Reviews.Title: Maybe, maybe not
Reviews.Author: JerryWithaJ
Reviews.Content: [Since no one has expressed an opinion as to whether my review is helpful, I'm not having any second thoughts about rewriting it rather than appending an "added in edit" section".]The X202E gets 5 stars simply because there's no other product that offers these features at this price point.  The word "wonderful" is even not inappropriate. Crisp HD picture. 500 GB hard drive. A touch screen!  Where else are you going to get so much value?The i3 processor seems to be fine, that is, not underpowered, but it's the old question of how much power one needs for one's day-to-day activities.I got it (Lord, help me) solely because I wanted some experience with Win 8 Touch since many of my students will likely be arriving with Win 8 computers in September. (Quick aside.  From all the press I'd read, I had the impression that Win 8 was so different from Win 7 that no right-thinking person would want to use it.  Wrong! It's actually growing on me.  I'll blog about it at JustLikeTheOtherOne.) This machine is excellent for that!Two comments to keep this from becoming another me too review:* The sensitivity of the touchpad is starting to bother me.  It's not as bad as my B23E, but no way near well behaved as, say, my t101mt or 1008HA. I have discovered that the random jumping is reduced by using only one hand to operate the touchpad (no clicking with the left while scrolling with the right), but am about to install the free toughpad blocker utility.  This is the first Asus machine I've had where I felt the keyboard itself was inconsistently responsive.  Too many keystrokes that don't register and a Ctrl-v combination that requires considerable pressure on the left Ctrl key, but not (yet?) enough for me to take off a star or send the machine in for service.* The battery is not replaceable by the user. The typical user would have to send it in for service in a couple of years. By then, it may be obsolete, tho'. However, it's the kind of machine that can grow on you, so you might find yourself doing it for sentimental reasons and then wondering why you gave in, as I did with my 1008HA.

Reviews.Title: great touchscreen
Reviews.Author: bob b.
Reviews.Content: Product has exceeded expectations.  Very easy to use out of the box.  I would highly recommend this computer.  This was my first Asus product, and it will not be the last.

Reviews.Title: don't cover up air intake vent on bottom of laptop
Reviews.Author: frank
Reviews.Content: Nice little machine. However, about 4 days ago it crashed. This was after watching a movie when the laptop was on my lap. When I would try and boot up it would say stuff like "trying to repair", but it didn't boot up to Windows. I figured it was a bad hard drive, since the hd kept making the same clicks over and over. But my brother-in-law said the hard drive was still good, it just had a bad sector the hard drive was trying to access. It finally booted up out of the blue when it was on yesterday. So I went and got a usb drive to do a backup of the system (just in case the hd crashed permanently). (Use the program called "create a recovery drive".) It crashed again today after watching some minutes of youtube videos while the laptop was on my lap. Fortunately it booted back up again. My guess is that it was getting overheated since I was covering up the air intake vent on the bottom both times before it crashed?. (When the pc was fixing itself after the 2nd crash it said I could look up "Kernal_data_inpage_error" - I haven't looked into that yet, so I don't know what that is about.)

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop
Reviews.Author: JamesB.
Reviews.Content: I was little bit surprised that a laptop at this price can be this good. Very, very sleek and sturdy construction. Nice looking piece of hardware. The I3 is plenty fast enough if you are not a gamer. A great daily laptop. I particularly bought it for travel due its size. After reading others great reviews and a promo code from another seller I made the purchase. Windows 8 takes a little adjustment but it does have desktop mode. I also placed a GODMODE file on the desktop solving the problem of no start menu. Windows 8 can beak tweaked quite a bit but the settings are all over the place. Google GODMODE file for windows 8 for directions. This will put all your settings in that file on your desktop, makes it a breeze to tweak. I highly recommend this piece of hardware.

Reviews.Title: Great quality and value
Reviews.Author: Chris Snelgrove
Reviews.Content: This is a great small form notebook.It's well made and quiet; I can't hear it when it's turned on!For the price it's hard to beat!!

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised
Reviews.Author: innovator4life
Reviews.Content: This is a great little laptop.It was delivered in the earlier part of the time frame and I had to have FedEx hold it for me. I find I use the touchscreen more than I thought I would.

Reviews.Title: Super Portable
Reviews.Author: Fede
Reviews.Content: This is a real super portable notebook and affordable over all.Even it's an entry level ultrabook it has cool functions as the touch screen ideal to deal with Windows 8 and pretty nice terminations.I bought it for my mom, she commutes every day and doesn't need a super computer.If you work every day in your office you can connect a USB keyboard for a better experience.

Reviews.Title: Best touchscreen Windows 8 netbook replacement for the money
Reviews.Author: I'm not perfect
Reviews.Content: The keyboard, and track pad are excellent. I wish it were a little lighter,weight, but it's a much better computer than my old netbook.

Reviews.Title: Excellent laptop for the value
Reviews.Author: Dee-Es
Reviews.Content: I recently just had the Asus VivoTab, which was a great productivity machine. However, it lacked one thing: a physical keyboard. As much as I love tablets, I need a laptop/ultrabook for the keyboard convenience factor. The VivoBook is an excellent little laptop running a great operating system and on top of that, its a touch screen. I think Windows 8 has its flaws, but I think it is the future of tablet and desktop computing. The VivoBook itself has an excellent keyboard and touch-screen. Its got an SD card, 3 USB ports, HDMI port, Ethernet connection and VGA connection. Just what I needed for on the go. 4GB of RAM and a 500 GB hard drive. What more could you ask for?? I would like to boost the memory up to 8GB, but after research, I learned its actually soldered in. I'm not complaining though. The only complaint I have is battery life. From other reviewers, I think at most you can get 4 hours out of this laptop. For those of you wanting to take this around, I would consider carrying a tablet or find some sort of power source just to make sure you have enough juice (this may vary on what you plan to do with the laptop). Simply put, this laptop is an excellent productivity machine as long as you don't throw everything at it. Web browing, email, Office work, and some entertainment. Dont expect to run PhotoShop and other heavy duty programs while browsing or editing music. This isnt that type of laptop: its built for portability and getting the small to medium tasks accomplished.

Reviews.Title: Affordable but has many flaws
Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: The computer has a nice screen and nice structure design. The Metal shine is really nice and the screen is nice and bright. However Windows 8 and the mouse pad seems to be the issue of it. It sometimes lags, slow down a bit. I hate the part when i'm desktop mode and when clicking on app it has to switch to metro style. (pretty annoying)I think the Touchpad is the defective part of this device. It's not very responsive, and it does require a 2nd try to get the job done.

Reviews.Title: Excellent computer
Reviews.Author: Carl B. Gustafson "Gus"
Reviews.Content: Brilliant screen and a good feel of the keyboard. Only had it for week and am still learning. Thickness and weight also good.

Reviews.Title: My doughtier loves it.
Reviews.Author: SimpleJack
Reviews.Content: My wife and I purchased the vivobook for my doughtier birthday, and she loves it. I've used a bit, and really liked the touch screen feature Niccce.

Reviews.Title: need only an illuminated Keyboard
Reviews.Author: MeMoNeer
Reviews.Content: hi,the only reason that make me gave 4 stars instead of 5 is the illuminated keyboard is not avaioable in this one. Which is very useful and practical. Now am writing the review from this item. It is just fine till now , touch screen is cool . I love the brad so I chose this guy.ALL GOOD ONLY THE ILLUMINAED KEYBOARDthanks

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop, my opinion
Reviews.Author: Peter W.
Reviews.Content: PROS:- Price!!!- Build quality- Performance- Design, I love it.- Light, even with charger and a wireless mouse in the bag .- Lots of ports for this size (2 usb 2.0, 1 usb 3.0, sd card, rj45, normal hdmi, audio/mic jack in one port, even VGA! incredible)- Big touch pad (and with proper updates it works just fine)- Nice keyboard layout and size- Battery life may or may not be a good thing for everyone in this notebook, but if you upgrade bios and tweak the power saving settings you will get a good amount of battery (3 to 4hs at high performance tasking, or 5 to 6hs at light performance tasking).- Touch screen!- Decent TN panel wich has nice color contrast and brightness (and also viewing angles are not that bad)- Sound quality is very nice! I was impressed the first time I listened to a song.- Some people have changed the wifi adaptor for better range or stability. I didn't, and so far it worked well!- Probably some other thing that I'm skipping right now heheCONS:- Glare screen. Yes, it is glare and it may be difficult to read with excesive light. Easily solved by some anti-glare protective lcd screen.- It takes finger prints easily.- It takes some time to be fully charged (battery).- No illuminated keyboard. At this price we can't argue about this, I know it... but I always want more hahaha.- No replaceable battery.- No memory upgrade capabilities.I bought it here at Amazon, price is just amazing: http://amzn.to/1637O6r

Reviews.Title: wireless issues when not powered
Reviews.Author: Serhan Ardanuc "metucastleinus"
Reviews.Content: It randomly disconnects when I have 3-4 bars out of 5.Otherwise it is a decent buy...Would be better if it came with LINUX though

Reviews.Title: Pros and Cons
Reviews.Author: Stocker
Reviews.Content: This computer is really great, but there are some flaws to it. Sometimes the mouse pad thing doesn't really work, but I still like it. Also, it takes a long time to download something, and it's not just the wi-fi. Without the flaws, I think that this computer could be a worldwide bestseller.

Reviews.Title: Great computer for a 'non computer guy'
Reviews.Author: MICHIGAN 2012
Reviews.Content: I thought I would write my first review because I wanted to let people who are on the fence about this computer to buy it.  I am not too technologically inclined, and I fight it at all costs.  But I need a computer that can run Windows 8 and also use all of the Microsoft Office Suite.  And this computer is just the right trick.  At 399 from Amazon, it was actually cheaper than some of the automatic sellers that came up when I looked at ASUS.  And it is also awesome that being at 399 it is in between the values of $200-400 square trade warranty of $80 instead of $150 if the computer was just $1 dollar more.  So that is also a win-win.  I have been using this computer and I am getting over 4 hours of life and the touch screen is so responsive.  It is also my first touch screen computer and I love it.  IT is light, and easy to move in a brief case, or shoulder bag.the case construction is great, and I bought the grey one so it looks like an Apple but it is a lot cheaper.  My wife has an Apple laptop, and she is constantly using mine because of the size, and brightness of the screen.  Overall, I love this computer, and I think that ASUS has a definite advantage in the powerful, small, 11.6 inch computer market.  If you made it this long in my review, then your next step is to just buy it.  You wont be sorry!!

Reviews.Title: windows 8 and Touch
Reviews.Author: Richard D. Miller
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice light weight laptop.  IT is NOT a fast high end unit.  However for everday e-mail, web browsing, and music it does a very nice job.  The touch screen is very responsive. I am enjoying the new Win 8 with touch.  I can hardly wait for the 8.1 preview which comes out soon  Also a couple of folks stated the unit does have a way to do a restore.  This is partially true.  I contacted ASUS customer support.  The provided me a link to download a piece of software called ASUS Backtracker which enables you to make a restore USB drive.  Highly recommend doing that.  Many folks complained about the touch pad however I have no issues.  Very happy with the purchase and the Price WOW.  I got it for $399 with $50 off for signing up for the Amazon CC.

Reviews.Title: Good, Light, Fast but the touchpad is not sensitive enough
Reviews.Author: Esthee Wong H Y
Reviews.Content: The laptop looks nice out of the box, with silver metalic finish, and feels solid and well built.  It is quite light, and the small footprint makes it convenient for using it when traveling, in public transport, etc.  It does heat up quite  a bit, but less than my full sized laptops.  The battery life is good, I did not do any formal tests, but it certainly lasts enough to watch a movie and do some work on the plane... The processor/memory combo is fast enough for all basic tasks, including some image editing, PDF annotations and creation, having 30 tabs open in the browser, etc.  Win 8 advantage.A tablet would be even smaller, of course, but I do prefer the built in keyboard, easy to adjust screen angle, etc.  I had apprehensions about Win 8 , but I must say it is fast and easy to adapt to, and once you customize the screens to your own preference (and it's not that difficult!), it works quite nicely, I now prefer it to Win 7.  ASUS included software is forgettable...One gripe I have is the touchpad.  The buttons are not separate from the rest of the touchpad surface, and this makes for frequent hit and miss with moving the cursor and clicking.  It also feels a bit stiff compared to the separate buttons design.The touch screen is nice and quite sensitive, compared, say, to Samsung tablets, but I find that I rarely use it, perhaps will get used to it later...Overall,  a good small laptop, good experience with the hardware and Win 8, quite happy with the purchase, especially given the very low price on Amazon  :)

Reviews.Title: Perfect for price
Reviews.Author: Asif Kadri
Reviews.Content: It has Everything I was looking forOnly thing missing is. Widi support but not big dealNo need of tablet anymore

Reviews.Title: Returned in 2 days
Reviews.Author: Yuan Shi
Reviews.Content: The first day screen defected, I wasn't touching anything and it just tapped itself like crazy. Rebooted and become fine. So I decided to give it another chance the next day, and then there comes issue turning on the laptop itself (after several try it turned normal). Can Not Believe It. Returned the laptop in 2 days. Amazon return service is good.

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Areum Cho
Reviews.Content: I am in college so that I needed compact size. This is perfect for me!And this touch screen is fantastic! It's really convenient.Quality is also satified!I strongly recommand it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: Very nice product
Reviews.Author: Ranga Reddy Bapuram
Reviews.Content: This is a nice product. Touch screen is very good. Very compact. Getting use to the windows 8 but so far it is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Owned for a few months now.
Reviews.Author: P. Hall "Courage"
Reviews.Content: I really like the size of this computer for the price.  It is a well built and does exactly what I need it to.  It is lightweight and pretty much an ultra book.  The touchscreen utilizes Windows 8 brilliantly.  This platform should only continue to grow in the future.

Reviews.Title: Notebook computer
Reviews.Author: David Punnett
Reviews.Content: I am really enjoying this computer.  I purchased  the computer for traveling so I could have a thin/light computer.  It does all I need it to do.  Perfect

Reviews.Title: frustrating ultrabook for the price, and has made me cranky
Reviews.Author: condomax
Reviews.Content: The size, weight, and price of this device are all in line with expectations.  It has performed well and I like that it has the versatility that I need.  I wish that there were more choices for ultrabooks with less reflective screens but I guess this is the downside of touch screens.1/5/2014 - update.  The huge disappointment in this device is either the device or how it works with Windows 8.  The touch screen is flaky and unreliable.  I frequently have to hit fn + f7 to reset the touch screen (or whatever this does) in order to use the touch screen feature.  Additionally, the edges of the screen rarely, if ever, work for touchscreen-ability.  I did the calibration thing, but no luck.  Why did I pay for a touchscreen device?  Also, the bluetooth feature (either because of Windows 8.1 or Toshiba's automatic update) stopped working properly with my Android.  It pairs successfully but every time I try to look at files on the Android, it says "FTP failed" or something like it.  I'm not sure how I will get this working again.  Time to google it.  I like everything else about this device, but these other discoveries have been disturbing.  A side not is that the battery life is somewhat short, but I knew this when I bought it.2/26/2014 - update.  Changed my review to 1 star.  Losing all patience with the way the mouse and cursor and touch screen don't work properly or consistently and/or non-intuitively.  I have to fn+f7 constantly in order to get cursor/mouse control back.  In addition, the wifi connection is flaky.  I often have to restart the device after moving to a different wifi network because the device can't figure out how to stay connected.  I'm ready to throw this device through a window.

Reviews.Title: Very good value for the money
Reviews.Author: R. L. McDonald
Reviews.Content: I've had this laptop for over a month now and really like it.  I bought it at a Windows store for $499.  It came with a half hour class on Windows 8, a book worth about $20, and a $20 gift card.For everyday home use I believe it is one of the best values out there.  It will not play Call of Duty of course, but it handles Microsoft office, web use, and e-mail very well.  It took a little while to get used to Windows 8, but now I really like it on this laptop.  Windows 8 needs a touch screen to get the most out of it.  It's easy to go from the New interface to the desktop.  Windows apps are run from the new interface, Windows programs are run from the desktop, just like in Windows 7.  It took a couple of weeks to get to know the new operating system.  From the desktop it acts just like Windows 7.  There are even freeware programs that will bring back the start button if you want a more Windows 7 like experience.The touch screen is very responsive, have had no delays or hang ups.  The programs load and respond with no delay.  The core i3 3rd generation ivy bridge is powerful enough to run all the apps and programs.  It handles photo editing well, I have Corel paintshop pro X4, for heavy editing and a photo app for light editing.  Mail, Facebook, Twitter and Netflix all have apps.  I can watch 2 netflix movies on a single charge, (I didn't run the battery down to see how long it really lasts).  The search function is nice, just start typing.  It will search for folders, programs, apps, inside documents, and on the web.  Just choose which one you want searched.I can't review the touch pad.  I hate touch pads don't use them if something else is available.  I didn't notice any CPU "whine", but the fan is audible, but not that loud.  The graphics aren't 1080P, but they're still good.  I like the power supply, it's small and not the brick which came with my old Dell laptop.With the touchscreen, this laptop has tablet like functionality, but can run PC software.  I have an iPad that I never use that cost twice as much as the ASUS X202E.  I just couldn't find a need for the iPad, but this laptop fits my needs nicely, at half the cost.Remember, this is a $500 laptop.  So you wont be getting a SSD or back lit keyboard, you have to pay more for those.  For general use, it will be hard to beat this laptop.

Reviews.Title: Sweet little machine!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is one sweet little machine, a full Windows laptop at an incredible price.  With amazing sound through the speakers!The Windows 8 "Metro" interface starts to make some sense on a touch screen.  Personally, I think MS has a ways to go here, but I can see what they were thinking.If, like me, you install one of the free utilities available to skip Metro altogether, you've essentially got a Windows 7 system with all the under the hood improvements that Win 8 brings, plus touch screen capabilities.  I really like getting my hands off the keyboard and mouse, and for some tasks in particular (like scrolling long pages) the touch interface on the traditional desktop works great.All this in a beautiful package so light that you don't hesitate to bring it along.  Battery life at ~5 hours is a bit shorter than I'd prefer, and the arrow keys are small, so they take a little getting used to, but I am NOT complaining.The true test, of course, is with the household computer snob, whose usual comment about any laptop is "a Macbook Air is so much better," but who has voiced not a word of complaint about this machine.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded Expectations
Reviews.Author: Frank Zilm
Reviews.Content: I purchased this laptop to upgrade from an aging HP Tx2000.  I have a ton of applications, including AutoCad, Simul8, CorelDraw, etc.The new laptop arrived five days ago.  So far everything going exceptionally well.  All apps have uploaded in Windows 8, The laptop is responsive.Other review criticize the battery life.  I have not tested this yet, but I can live with a 4 hour battery.Exceptional value so far.

Reviews.Title: Swap the hard drive with an SSD
Reviews.Author: Ronald Foster
Reviews.Content: I picked up this laptop from Amazon along with a Samsung 128gb SSD.  I was originally planning to buy a Dell Latitude 10 Windows 8 tablet, but it has been delayed due to driver issues.  The word is that the new Atom chips are not really fast enough anyway.  I first tried to clone the hard disk to the SSD using some free utilities, but due to the UEFI bios the free cloning programs produced disk images that would not boot.  I then used a copy of Acronis True Image 13 and it worked.  I am very happy with the results.  I now have the equivalent of a touch screen ultrabook for a little over $600.  The laptop recovers from hibernation in under 10 seconds.  It is obvious to me that the future of laptops running Windows 8 will be to have touch screens.  I find that I like using a mouse better in the Windows 7 mode, and the touch screen better in the UI mode.  I am very satisfied with my x202e/SSD combination.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Abdulquadri M. Olawin
Reviews.Content: I am a fan of computers, and this one just perfects it. Thank you for the discount. Thank you for everything.

Reviews.Title: Our 15 1/2 year-old loves it!
Reviews.Author: Angie J. Avers
Reviews.Content: It didn't take long to get familiar with it and it is definitely a hit. She takes it with her everywhere already and school hasn't even resumed from the holidays.

Reviews.Title: Ultraportable
Reviews.Author: Adam Smyth "Adam"
Reviews.Content: Bought it for its size and its speed. Just need this laptop for the basics and it does just that. Great buy at a great price

Reviews.Title: Good computer, good price
Reviews.Author: Esteban
Reviews.Content: It is an excellent option but it needs an ssd disk in order to increment the computer performance. Despite of that, it is a good computer!!!

Reviews.Title: Woohoo!
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: This computer is pretty sweet. Intel i3 processor is nifty. Windows 8 is nifty... once you get the hang of it. Touchscreen is nifty. Trackpad shortcuts are nifty... once you get the hang of them. There's not really a built-in tutorial or anything, and it's not super intuitive, so learning takes a bit of time and research. But it's pretty slick once you get used to it. The touchpad acts up when there are updates, but I think it will probably get sorted out eventually. Also, Windows' app store kind of sucks for the time being. They don't get along with Google, so the few Google apps there are are not very developed, or cost money where they wouldn't on Google Play (i.e. with Android). There is no good Youtube app yet. But I think it will probably get better with time. As a Windows computer, it does everything and more. So yeah, no real complaints here. Rock on!

Reviews.Title: It died with 2 months of use.
Reviews.Author: Monica Oliveira
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews, but I read them all. Recognizing the importance of all the people that helped me to make decisions by reading a review when I buy at Amazon, I am writing my first one. I am not a computer expert, I am a user that has enough knowledge to use a computer and fix most issues. After researching the few reviews available, and because of the good price and size, I bougth this laptop for traveling. I had a small old Lenovo and It was giving me problems. So I got this one as my Christmas gift. The problems began when I was trying to transfer my files. It has 3 partitions in the hard drive and a friend of mine, that was helping me to set up the laptop, could not transfer all my music from Itunes. Win 8 was new and we did not know if it was the ASUS problem or Win 8 problem and how to combine 2 partitions. To learn Win 8 took me a bit and meanwhile I was using the desktop that runs as a Win 7. The keyboard on the screen is very nice and I loved the the touch screen. The problem was to figure  what link should be touched to open and which one should be opened with the keyboard. The touch screen is not in all the screen like the iPad. Then it took me forever to get a cd drive to work with it. I bought and I returned several. Finally I used it in the first trip and the battery was not enough for a 3 hours plane trip. I blamed on my ignorance of win 8 and the set ups. I kept using to learn win 8. I was happy with the new toy, but I started to find the inconveniences. To use it as a tablet is great idea, but the keyboard is in between you and the screen. If I had one that I could twist or flip the keyboard it would be much better. It is an Useless screen keyboard if you the keyboard is in between you and the screen. Then I eventually went back to my HP, and set it aside just for traveling. One morning I decided to use it, I was in the middle of a CE credit online class and a message came saying it was going to shut down. I tried to stop it and it was impossible. This was the end of my affair with ASUS. It would not load win 8 or any thing else. Next day I took it to OfficeMax, thinking it was a software problem. They researched online, they called several technicians and they could not figure it out. I called Adorama Camera, that sold it to me here on Amazon and it was after 90 days, I got it in December. I could not return it. I took to Best Buy and they had it for 2 weeks, then they told me the hard drive died. Best Buy tried to send it to ASUS and they couldn't because I did not buy it on Best Buy. I called myself ASUS and they told me to send to them but back up my files first. How ? I could not do it if the machine does not come up! Took it back to Best Buy and I had to pay Best Buy to do it and buy an external hard drive. It cost me to diagnose it, to back up my files, for the hard drive and to ship to ASUS. They don't send a box just a RA. The machine is now with ASUS and I am waiting for it to come back. I have a trip coming up and I decided to get another laptop. I am going back to the Lenovo brand. All the technicians told me the same. I will sell the ASUS on Craigslist.  I did not get a warranty from Amazon. It was not offered and it was a not an expensive machine I thought it would be OK just with the 1 year manufacturer  warranty. Bad choice. Who knows when it  will come back and if they will fixed it. I am not confident anymore. Bad luck or a bad machine, I don't know.  I have to start from scratch with all the transfers and installations again. Besides, I lost all my CE answers and if  I have to do it all over I will do it in a new laptop. Now  I know all I need in a touch screen win 8 laptop. By the way, I took my old Lenovo to be checked and it cost me $40 to change the RAM memory that was making the machine turn off all the time. It is working great again.Boooo to ASUS, Booo to Adorama Camera and BOOOOOO to myself for my bad choice. Be aware and good luck if you choose this machine.

Reviews.Title: Here is my experience with J&R;
Reviews.Author: Elina
Reviews.Content: I love the Product, but got it in terrible condition and disappointed in Customer ServiceI would like to let you know that I'm really upset with the products I got from J&R.;First ASUS X202EDH I purchased from Amazon had a huge dead pixel on the screen.Through Amazon I contacted the J&R; regarding exchanging the item. They contacted me right away and were very helpful when I called them regarding expediting the shipping because the computer was a gift for my mom's birthday. They provided me with RA # and sent out the product which I got on time.Second ASUS X202EDH I got as a replacement seemed to be used.When I turned the laptop ON, I got the following message: Automatic Repair.I was surprised why would I see it. Usually it starts from choosing a Language, accepting an Agreement, and so on.Anyways.. I followed instructions and Refrashed it. After refreshing I faced another issue,an Other User window which requests a Log In and Password. It seems like this laptop is used (not new).I had no idea what should I do with that product because I cannot get an access..I contacted J&R; one more time.They told me that they are happy to replace it. I just need to confirm to process RA.I replied that I would consider my options:1. If I decide to exchange it, how can I be sure that it's going to be a new computer (not the one which was previously returned by other customer and restored)?2. If I keep this laptop, do you normally give a discount on used items?I was not contacted back.I found the person who is knowledgeable in computers and helped me to get an access to the computer.I decided to  keep it because it was already after my mom's birthday and she wanted to use it.A few months later, the battery started to die very fast.I contacted to seller one more time.They stated that they never got an email from me and this is to late to get any feather help from them and I need to contact to Manufacturer. They reply was with an attitude. I completely understand that you cannot take care of the customer after curtain time, but do not show me you attitude! I already got a used product from you plus paid as for a new!I'm so disappointed.

Reviews.Title: exactly what i wanted!!!
Reviews.Author: Gratianne Yhap
